title: Tanks should have individual power curves just like any other class
body:
balancing them and all of their items around mid game strength is one of the biggest reasons they overlap so much and suffer from "this guy does something better than I do, so I am not meta" that is common with tanks. 

there are early game supports, junglers, lane bullies -- there's even early game marksmen. shuffle tanks around to excel at certain parts of the game to better fit comps. Tank items should be a part of this curve as well, though I'm not sure how we can do that in the same vein as lethality vs crit depending on when you want to power spike.

I think there are some problems with what you say and what some people say here in the thread - eg it's kind of hard to create an early game "tank" because people think "tank" = "vanguard". And vanguards have CC by definition which means they generally do not fall off hard.
However, Juggernauts could very well be considered "tanky" and "strong in the early, but falling off late".

So there are some problems that make it somewhat hard to create an "early game tank" and the like. Some other comparisons to ADCs for examples are somewhat missleading because marksman as a class are strong late - so when an "early game marksman" like Lucian kills a "strong lategame tank" like Sejuani then that's not necessarily a problem - especially seeing how tanks usually (!) don't compete with marksmen when it comes to a certain pick. The way that tanks and marksmen scale is somewhat connected because marksmen depend on protection to deal tons of DPS and tanks can protect but need someone to DPS in the lategame. That means together they outscale assassins and divers as a class (exceptions etc. are ofc there).

Now, nitpicking aside, I agree with you. As it is right now I really couldn't care less about whether we/they have a Nautilus or a Maokai toplane (aside from specific matchups that is). They offer about the same to their team, strong peel and lots of tankyness. Both fit into comps "that need a tank top" but further distinction is futile.

That is a problem that needs to be fixed and power curves may be one way to accomplish that

I just answered to the other guy above 

> Don't rely too much on Riot lists, they are actually a bit confused about juggernauts situation and that's why they are planning for a kind of tank rework, to clear up some inconsistency and reduce edge cases.

> Look at the same article that is referenced in the post you linked what is the definition of tank classes:

 > http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/dev-blog-classes-subclasses

> "Tanks excel in shrugging off incoming damage and focus on disrupting their enemies more than being significant damage threats themselves"

> He is placed into Juggernauts category only because he lack hard CC, he fit any other possibile description of tanks in this game stated by same Riot words...and he has far more in common with tanks rather than with champs like Nasus, Darius, Morde or Yorick.

> Not all the tanks are about doing the same things, and Mundo has his own thing going for him as unique tank, just like other champs have their unique things going for them in other roles

But I want to point out some other things you said:

- about tanking tower damage: "Trundle can. Garen comes close. If Mordekaiser can keep his shield up he can." 
WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU SMOKING DUDE? Garen can come close to Mundo in tanking constant damage  output received? That's one of the stupidest things ever said. Garen "tankiness" come almost entirely by his regen passive that gives sustain OUT of combat when he does not receive damage. If he get CCed under tower, especially if he is not using his high cooldown W- which he should save to be able jump into the enemy team without being istantly blowed up if a fight happens - he is taking considerable damage. He is one of the worst juggernaut/tanks for tanking towers in a siege situation, because he has not great tankiness, low regen/sustain in combat, and low mobility to get out. If he start tanking a pair of shots and get CCed while the tower has still enough health, he is in serious trouble.
Morde shield is something you can't rely on in those siege situations, because the shield is built upon doing damage in combat, which is not happening when you are sieging and so basically the shield is decaying or has yet decayed. He has even lower sustain and mobility to get out. Morde can reliably siege only if he has the ghost tanking for him, but this require having succesfully killed some enemy with the ult or the drake.
Trundle is by far the best of the three guys you mentioned for sieging, but not because his ability of tanking damage, he is actually not good at doing that, he is good because he can zone enemy away from defending tower with the pillars or use the pillar to escape cutting enemy chase path (enhanced by his W). 
**Trundle is also the guy who is the farthest away from Juggernaut and closer to tank definition among the mentioned ** by the way, **as pillar is a tool that allows them to initiate and peel  as proof of that he hs been succesfully used as support**, which is a thing other Juggernauts can't do (heck, he was even specifically mentioned as been as Warden-Juggernaut Hybrid in the original article about subclasses)

Mundo IS a Juggernaut (official subclass list with examples provided by Riot http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/3A5uuBw7-champion-subclass-list ). He doesn't provide any hard CC, he can't protect anyone, he can't peel, he can't engage. His kit is all about damage and healing himself to hurt enemy as much as possible. Even Jhin with tanky itemization can tank turrets but it doesn't make him tank (though because of snare he would be better as one than Mundo).

> I'm also talking about champs like Braum or Ali or Blitz sup

Braum gives buffs to his allies, protects them with shield and peels with passive and R, Ali heals allies, peels with W and protects with Q, Blitzcrank is special snowflake and he doesn't fit into any class (but he brings tones of hard CC and lockdown).

> some tanks are meant to be a meatshield brickwall to protect their own carries or to provide an impossible to ignore distraction tot he enemy team, cause if you can't keep Mundo down/ away from you he is going to murder you (try to ignore a Mundo...then se your ADC get f*ed)
